events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred yesterday afternoon, requesting to file a claim for the damages to their vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under auto accident cases due to reported vehicle collision and injuries.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to the case to ensure the customer receives proper support throughout the process.
The customer was notified that their claim has been received and is now being processed by the insurance company.
The claims department requested photographs of the damaged vehicle, police report, and medical reports for further evaluation.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including detailed repair estimates and a copy of the police accident report.
The investigation team began assessing the accident circumstances and verifying the authenticity of submitted documents.
Investigation concluded confirming the fault and evaluating the damage cost, validating the claim for approval.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and medical expenses related to the accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with how the claim was handled and appreciated the timely communication.
The claim was formally approved based on investigation findings and customer agreement to the proposed settlement.
The insurance company issued payment to the customerâ€™s account to cover the agreed settlement amount.
The claim file was officially closed after confirmation of payment receipt and customer acknowledgment of full settlement.
The case documents and claim details were archived in the company records for future reference and audit purposes.
